page.title: 11Badlesmere : Stock Farming
page.content: Stock farming is of lesser importance though all farmers have a flock of from 5O - 2OO sheep kept for fat lamb production. A dairy herd of l5O Brit. Friesians produces an average 55OO/litre/cow/year. Milk production is limited by EEC quota. Cows are kept at grass in summer and housed in straw yards in winter where each consumes l.l/2 tons concentrate (cost Â£l45/ton) and 8.l/2 tonnes silage on self feed system. Average milk price to farmer is l5.5 pence/litre. Cows are milked twice daily by l man in an automated parlour. All calves are kept; the pure Friesians for herd replacements and the males and crossbreds for beef production.
